RECORD.TEXT: 825330116 HLGMC 6051380 10615/2646 ACUTE MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION . DIS 8-15-93 DISCHARGE DATE : 08-22-93 Acute myocardial infarction . ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSIS : 1. Coronary artery disease , 2. unstable angina ( postmyocardial infarction angina ) , 3. Parkinson 's disease . SPECIAL PROCEDURES AND OPERATIONS : 1. Percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty and coronary atherectomy of the left anterior descending , 8-17-93 , DOCTORS DISCHARGE ORDERS AND MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Ecotrin 1 tablet PO qd , Captopril 6.25 mg PO tid , K-Dur 20 mEq. PO qd , Lasix 20 mg PO qd , Isordil 10 mg PO tid , Sinemet 1/2 tablet PO bid , Symmetrel 100 mg PO bid , Parloder 2.5mg PO qd . The patient is a 58 year old female with a history of Parkinson 's disease for more than twenty years who presented to the Gemenadentoolpai Medical Center with a revolving anterolateral wall myocardial infarction on 08-01-93 . She has been under the care of Dr. Aalv Manual and was referred here for further therapy . She had no prior significant cardiac history and presented to her local medical doctor 's office with an episode of severe retrosternal chest pain . In addition , on telemetry she developed complete heart block and hypotension requiring temporary pacing wire and then a permanent pacemaker implantation on 08-03-93 . She developed congestive heart failure and required pressor support . She underwent cardiac catheterization on 8-15-93 and was found to have a left ventricular end diastolic pressure of 28 millimeters of mercury . She had a dominant right coronary artery with minor disease . The main left coronary artery had a 20% stenosis . The circumflex artery had a minor 40% stenosis . Cine left ventriculogram revealed a dilated left ventricle with an area of anterolateral , apical , and septal akinesis . The left ventricular ejection fraction was estimated to 38% . The patient was transferred to the Heaonboburg Linpack Grant Medical Center for consideration of coronary angioplasty . CARDIAC RISK FACTORS : PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Her past medical history is remarkable for a history of Parkinson 's disease . Her physical examination at the time of admission revealed a pleasant lady in no acute distress . The carotids were normal . The chest was clear . The cardiac examination revealed anapical impulse in the fifth left intercostal space , left to mid clavicular line . The second sound was normally split . She had no murmurs and no gallops . The examination the abdomen was benign . She had good pulses bilaterally . LABORATORY DATA : There were prominent Q-waves in AVL , consistent with lateral myocardial infarction . The patient was admitted to the Medical Service . The patient was seen in consultation by the Neurology Department because of the history of Parkinson 's disease . The patient was maintained on intravenous heparin . Following balloon angioplasty , there was a local dissection with evidence of intraluminal thrombus , with a greater than 10% loss in the initial gain following coronary angioplasty . The patient tolerated the procedure well . Specifically , there was no decrease in the initial gain that she achieved after directional atherectomy .
